name: places/ChIJmU5P6vBYwokRO73p8vAMXUE
formattedAddress: 36 Central Park S South, New York, NY 10019, USA
adrFormatAddress: 36 Central Park S South, New York, NY 10019, USA

editorialSummary.text: Airy quarters, some with Central Park views, in an upscale hotel with a chic restaurant & a bar.

originalText.text: I stayed here twice so far over the years and one of them was during their construction. Best thing about this hotel is the panoramic view of Central Park you can get from the higher floors. I caught a memorable rare moment on 9/11 while in town from my room window that I won‚Äôt forget. As I mentioned, location is great and staff is wonderful. Room was spacious, bedding was good. Amenities were decent and they have a nice small gym. I didn‚Äôt get to try their hotel bar, rose lane and rooftop signature restaurant and bar ‚ÄúDarling‚Äù as I already had reservations planned for my whole stay. Definitely will consider in my future visits and highly recommend if you are looking for a fantastic Central Park view.

originalText.text:
Its been 4 years since I last visited New York. This why I was looking for a hotel where I can truly feel the city. There was no better choice than a place with a spectacular view of the Park
My stay was really amazing. Here are a couple of points:
Check in process was fast. Is this something important? Definitely it is. I have been to a couple of hotels where the check in process takes for ever. Here at the Park Lane hotel, it went fast and smooth.
Elevators: Frequent visitors of New York may understand why I list elevators as one of the criteria to rate a hotel. At times, the wait for hotels could really be frustrating. Not in this hotel.
Dining: I tried the breakfast at the 46th floor roof top Darling bar. The views are magnificent and the service was great. Food quality is average but the staff put extra efforts to make you enjoy your food and drinks
The room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. One improvement needed would be upgrading the blackouts curtains to be auto operated instead of manually

Overall, I really enjoyed my stay and this will definitely be my place of choice for future visits to NYC

originalText.text: Great place to stay. Staff are helpful and welcoming. The Darling restaurant on top of the building has a great breakfast continental style with vodka/champagne included. If you have capital one venture x the hotel is a member of the premier collection and you get that breakfast daily for free ($75/per person value!). Highly recommend this place. Our view of the park from the 27th floor was incredible!!! ü§©

text.text: Great place to stay. Staff are helpful and welcoming. The Darling restaurant on top of the building has a great breakfast continental style with vodka/champagne included. If you have capital one venture x the hotel is a member of the premier collection and you get that breakfast daily for free ($75/per person value!). Highly recommend this place. originalText.text:
The best part about this hotel is its location being south of Central Park and close to 5th Avenue, and with that the view of Central Park. That was spectacular

There was a great anticipation leading up to our stay as we got the park view room for our 4 nights stay, and the reservation team was very helpful with changes of our reservation.

However, our first night was a little rocky. We came to a room with a malfunction thermostat, so the room was overheating. Had someone from engineer that came to manipulate the heater, but eventually, was given a portable heater for the night. The next morning, the floor around the heater was soaked with likely leakage from the heater.

Went to speak to the duty manager - Ryan; was very apologetic and was given a different room. We were very appreciative of that

The housekeeping was very flaky, towels were replaced inconsistently in our room. For the price per room, it doesn‚Äôt come with toilet amenities except for towels and toiletries, no coffee or tea  in room or common area.

The hotel guest lifts were shared with Public guests that were trying to access the rooftop  restaurant, which was very inconvenient and less private.

In conclusion, probably one of the cheaper option hotel with CP view, but we are unlikely to return.

originalText.text:
It's pretty perfect as New York hotels go... Location, location, location near some of the best restaurants right across the street from Central Park right near the best shopping.  Everything just steps from the door.  The room was ordinary size...not small....not large... bathroom was nicely appointed...bed was comfortable.

Lobby bar had great coffee and breakfast options.
